com.codecool.shop.dao.implementation

Interface Queryhandler


  • public interface Queryhandler
    The Queryhandler interface handles database connection and SQL queries, while preventing SQL injections.
    Since:
    2018-05-11

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default java.sql.PreparedStatement createPreparedStatement(java.sql.Connection connection, java.lang.String query, java.util.List<java.lang.Object> parameters)
      Merges the SQL statement and the parameters into a query-ready prepared statement.
      default java.lang.Integer executeDMLQuery(java.lang.String query)
      Executes a DELETE, INSERT or UPDATE sql query
      default java.lang.Integer executeDMLQuery(java.lang.String query, java.util.List<java.lang.Object> parameters)
      Executes a DELETE, INSERT or UPDATE sql query
      default java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> executeSelectQuery(java.lang.String query)
      Executes a SELECT sql query
      default java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> executeSelectQuery(java.lang.String query, java.util.List<java.lang.Object> parameters)
      Executes a SELECT sql query
      default java.sql.Connection getConnection()
      Reading connection credentials from a file.
      java.lang.String getConnectionConfigPath()
      This method is used in the class for getting the file containing db connection credentials.

    • Method Detail

      • getConnectionConfigPath

        java.lang.String getConnectionConfigPath()
        This method is used in the class for getting the file containing db connection credentials. It has to be implemented by the implementing class.
        Returns:
        String file path

      • getConnection

        default java.sql.Connection getConnection()
        Reading connection credentials from a file.

        Uses getConnectionConfigPath() to get the file path. It's looking for the following key-value pairs in it:

        • db_name=[name of the database]
        • db_url=[IP and port for the database eg.: "localhost:5432"]
        • db_user=[user name for logging into the database]
        • db_password=[password for the user name]
        Returns:
        opened connection instance

      • createPreparedStatement

        default java.sql.PreparedStatement createPreparedStatement(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                                           java.lang.String query,
                                                           java.util.List<java.lang.Object> parameters)
                                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Merges the SQL statement and the parameters into a query-ready prepared statement.
        Parameters:
        connection - a connection instance (can get one with getConnection())
        query - the SQL statement as a string with "?" placed in as placeholders for parameters
        parameters - the list of parameters to be merged into the statement (in the order of appearance in the query)
        Returns:
        a PreparedStatement object
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if error occures in connection

      • executeDMLQuery

        default java.lang.Integer executeDMLQuery(java.lang.String query)
        Executes a DELETE, INSERT or UPDATE sql query
        Parameters:
        query - the query string
        Returns:
        the number of rows affected in the process

      • executeDMLQuery

        default java.lang.Integer executeDMLQuery(java.lang.String query,
                                          java.util.List<java.lang.Object> parameters)
        Executes a DELETE, INSERT or UPDATE sql query
        Parameters:
        query - the query string (including "?" as placeholders for parameters)
        parameters - parameters for the query (the same orders as they appear in the query)
        Returns:
        the number of rows affected in the process

      • executeSelectQuery

        default java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> executeSelectQuery(java.lang.String query)
        Executes a SELECT sql query
        Parameters:
        query - the query string
        Returns:
        a List of Map<String, Object> as the result of the query

      • executeSelectQuery

        default java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> executeSelectQuery(java.lang.String query,
                                                                                            java.util.List<java.lang.Object> parameters)
        Executes a SELECT sql query
        Parameters:
        query - the query string (including "?" as placeholders for parameters)
        parameters - parameters for the query (the same orders as they appear in the query)
        Returns:
        a List of Map<String, Object> as the result of the query
